owner.username: Mississippi Department of Archives and History

title._content: James Plantation and Copperas Bayou Camp, 1900 photograph collection.

description._content: Call Number: PI/1989.0019 System ID: 71365 Link to the catalog From [James Plantation and Copperas Bayou Camp, 1900 photograph collection]. One photograph is plantation of Thomas L. James., December 25, 1900 in Sharkey, Mississippi. ca 5 x 11 inches showing dirt road, plantation home and outbuildings in the background, a river to the left; upper left hand corner torn off, losing sky and part of river. One photograph is camp on Lower Copperas Bayou, Tallahatchie County, Mississippi on December 26, 1900. Same size, better condition; 3 or 4 hunters, their porters, a few dogs, 3 tents, 1 deer hung upside down. Please see our profile page for information on ordering. Scanned as tiff in 2010/04/23 by MDAH. Credit: Courtesy of the Mississippi Department of Archives and History
